Look for CS-R2 Strut in the Utility tab. They should be there. Stock struts wont work.

Quick Question: I have a "recover from the surface of..." mission, and I'm trying to have a kerbal on EVA attach a winch to the object on the surface. Problem is, whenever I try to place a magnet, grappling hook, or other item on the side of the object, it just falls off. When I try to grab an object in the winch, it says "there is nothing to unplug".

It seems like a really basic question, but I've been looking for a while and can't find an answer. Thanks!

is there any crew tube part? like the MKS flex-o-tube but more stockalike? it would be better than sending structural fuselages to connect bases modules, and would look cooler

Wait, did I miss something? When I try to attach parts (to ground or to another craft) from EVA, they won't "weld"/stick D:

Old KAS part attachement have been updated to Kerbal inventory System.

To attach a part, your kerbal need to be a engineer and have a tool in you inventory (wrench or electrical screwdriver) and equip it.

To do that, you can right click on it in your inventory or use the keyboard shortcut (1-8).

You can now attach part by pressing (and holding) "X" key when you are in "place mode" (= the part you want to place is green).

I'll work on a new KAS user guide next week (I planned to do it earlier but I had to finish some freelance work first ).

is there any crew tube part? like the MKS flex-o-tube but more stockalike? it would be better than sending structural fuselages to connect bases modules, and would look cooler

No (not yet). You can transfer your crew through pipes thouth.

I'm missing parts in the most recent release. I've unlocked the winch but there's nothing to connect it to. There are no pipe parts either, so as far as I can see, I can't connect/transfer resources between my ships with...anything in this mod. Inventory works fine, but the parts I installed the mod for are missing from the unlock tree.

There isn't even a "connector" or "pipe" end in my parts folder which leads me to believe they're integrated into something else? What am I missing?

This is likely another stock bug, but I find kerbals do a VERY poor job of hanging on when EVA in orbit. They drift up/down the latter past the edge and float off or just plane seem to let go and start floating away. Makes it a pain to attach/remove more then one part because you have to keep re-attaching the kerbal to the craft.

Hi

just downloaded and installed KIS and KAS (present versions).

Testing it with a rover and a SC-62 Container, I try for example to use a CS-RC2-Strut.

How does the astronaut "grab" or use it? All I can do is click and drag stuff from the container and "drop" it somewhere. How can I get the Kerbal to use it?

I did not find any useful youtube tutorials. Most of them show pop-up menus to click and use items but it does not show with my installation...

Any help is welcome

A couple of things about KIS/KAS that don't necessarily leap to the eye:

- It matters what class you are. I think only engineers can mount/unmount things.

- It takes tools to mount/unmount things (e.g. wrench, power drill). To equip, right-click on the item in your kerbal's inventory and choose "equip". You'll see the tool in your kerbal's hand.

- To attach something rather than just drop it loosely on the surface, first equip the proper tool, then hold down the "X" key before you drop. (This will turn your mouse cursor into an "attach" cursor.) To unattach something that's attached, hold the "G" key before grabbing.

There's a handy PDF user guide that comes with the mod; try rummaging through the mod's directories to find it.
Question merged into the thread for the mod.

This is likely another stock bug, but I find kerbals do a VERY poor job of hanging on when EVA in orbit. They drift up/down the latter past the edge and float off or just plane seem to let go and start floating away. Makes it a pain to attach/remove more then one part because you have to keep re-attaching the kerbal to the craft.

Yep, that's a stock thing, AFAIK. It's been that way for a while.

@kospy

Will there be a way to "grapple" or "grab" an object in space or the ground with kerbals so you can EVA the parts around? One thing I noticed is that if you have a large part in space, keeping kerbals near enough to that part without them drifting away is a big problem. If they could grab the part in some way they'd be able to help better with moving it without drifting away.

Is there any way to surface attach parts that are not normally surface attachable?

Whenever I place a connector port on an object and link it to another ship then time warp with the parts connected the connector port appears to "slide off" then when the time warp stops it sometimes snaps back but if you time warp again while its in motion it will stay "slid off" and you can't grab it with an engineer to unattach it because it says that other parts are attached to it.

Lastly whenever I put down a ground pylon and put a strut part on it I cannot attach another strut part from another vehicle to it. For example, I have a base that likes to bounce around after time warping. I was going to use the strut and pylon to "cement it" to the ground. Like an anchor. It keeps telling me that I cannot strut to other vehicles. I also tried using a connector port but whenever I time warp the pipe just breaks.
